Or you could improve the design so you were able to test all of your 
objects in isolation.

Kent
P.S. The interim answer is to make a test suite out of the three test 
suites and wrap that top level suite in a TestSetup. But take the 
time to understand and improve your design anyway.

--- In junit@y..., Jim Cheesman <jchees@m...> wrote:
> At 04:38 PM 18/09/01, you wrote:
> >hi.
> >I create a test suite of three classes, all of which I initialize
> >using TestSetup.However,is there anyway i can use the objects
> >initialized in TestSetup ,in the three "Test" classes ? I was
> >initially doing this by making all the three classes a subclass and
> >doing the initialization in the parent,but this only works when 
they
> >are not part of a TestSuite.
> >
> >any ideas ?
> 
> 
> Some kind of static (singleton?) class that holds them? Stick the 
> initialiser code in a static block so that they're only initialised 
the 
> once, a few getXXX methods and off you go...
